snippet: A moving map of the oceans’ currents will allow scientists to better understand how currents shift heat and carbon around the globe, underlying the dynamics of climate change.
abstract: Editorial lauds digital map of the ocean's currents produced by the Scientific Visualization Studio at the Goddard Space Flight Center; notes that map, which can be viewed online, will be used by scientists to better understand how ocean currents shift heat and carbon around the globe, underlying the dynamics of climate change.
lead_paragraph: A moving map of the oceans’ currents will allow scientists to better understand how currents shift heat and carbon around the globe, underlying the dynamics of climate change.

headline.seo: A New View of the Aqueous Globe
headline.main: A New View of the Aqueous Globe
headline.print_headline: A New View of the Aqueous Globe
